adjectives.description: conformal (comparative more conformal, superlative most conformal)

entries.meaning: That conforms, especially to the shape of something.
examples: Some are realizable in practical computational times; others giving ‘more conformal’ 3D dose distributions take longer and some invoke technology which is not readily available, such as intensity-modulated fields.

entries.meaning: (mathematics, of a transformation) That preserves angles between intersecting curves.
examples: This would have been tantamount to a conformal transformation.

entries.meaning: (cartography, of a map projection) That preserves relative angles over small scales, at all but a limited number of distinct points.
examples: On conformal map projections, the scale depends on location only and not direction.
